snippet: The center fielder on four Yankees World Series-winning teams received 9.6 percent of the vote, a long way from the 75 percent needed for induction.
abstract: The center fielder on four Yankees World Series-winning teams received 9.6 percent of the vote, a long way from the 75 percent needed for induction.
lead_paragraph: Bernie Williams was the first homegrown core Yankee from the recent championship seasons to appear on the Hall of Fame ballot. The election results announced Monday were not encouraging.

headline.main: Discouraging Start for Williams's Hall of Fame Prospects
